medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began in central epigastric area and gradually localized to top and mid right quadrants, lasting two days. The pain is constant with radiation towards the back. Patient also experienced nausea and vomiting (3 episodes, initial episode contained blood), diarrhea (10 episodes, no blood), and normal passing of flatus. Believed it was an episode of acid reflux initially but did not obtain relief from Mylanta. Last meal before pain began was pizza.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, Hypercholesterolemia, HTN, Peripheral Vascular Disease s/p left superficial femoral artery angioplasty with stent, Chronic back pain, Erectile dysfunction.
